result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.

(9:10 AM case called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Defendant Kristina K. Keppert appeared by video, in custody in Taycheedah Correction Institution. Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Kristina K. Keppert. Attorney Andrew T Knaak in court for Kristina K. Keppert. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
Defendant waives right to appear in person and wants to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to appear in person.
Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas, which the Court accepts.
Attorney Knaak requests a status conference in early January as is awaiting on discovery. State advises the discovery is ready for pick up at the front desk of the DA's Office.
Status Conference scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 9 am, defendant allowed to appear via Zoom.
Renumbering Count 5 to Count 1.
Order Granting Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum for a hearing on 10/24/2022 at 9:00 a.m.
Proposed Writ of Habeas Corpus
Preliminary Hearing, 09/20/2022
for transport for a hearing on 10/24/2022 at 9:00 a.m.
Proposed Order for Transport
Arraignment on October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Arraignment on October 20, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

(2:00 PM cases 22CF940, 22CF1008 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Defendant Kristina K. Keppert in court, in custody. Attorney Andrew T Knaak and Attorney Ryan Raymond in court for Kristina K. Keppert. Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance and wants to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance.
22CF1008:
State calls Investigator Lance Maske of the Eau Claire County Sheriff's Department, who is sworn and testifies.
Attorney Raymond conducts cross-examination of Investigator Maske. 
State conducts redirect of Investigator Maske. Witness excused.
State makes argument for bind over.
Attorney Raymond makes argument against bind over.
Court finds probable cause and binds the case over.
Arraignment in 22CF1008 to be scheduled with Branch 6 Judicial Assistant.
22CF940:
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in 22CF940 and Court accepts waiver. 
Arraignment in 22CF940 to be scheduled with Branch 2 Judicial Assistant.
for transport for a hearing on 09/20/2022 at 2:00 p.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Kristina K. Keppert
Current: 50 E Spruce Street, Chippewa County Jail, Chippewa Falls, WI 54729 United States  (Effective: 09-09-2022)
Prior: 321 W Chippewa St, Cadott, WI 54727

(Case called at 11:02 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Kristina Keppert appears in custody via video conference from the Chippewa County Jail with Attorney Ryan Raymond. District Attorney Peter Rindal appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint. State requests $750,000 cash bond- recites facts alleged in the Probable Cause portion of the complaint and recites the Defendant's previous failures to appear in court. Defense requests $100,000 cash bond. Court orders $750,000 cash bond with various conditions. Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. Defendant updates her address. 
Preliminary Hearing: 09/20/2022 at 2:00 PM.

Conditions: 
No contact with P.N., V.K. (co-defendants).
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
CO-DEFENDANT
